movies.title: Island of Greed
movies.plot: Island of Greed is a 1997 Hong Kong action crime thriller film directed by Michael Mak and starring Andy Lau and Tony Leung Ka-fai. The film is set and filmed in Taiwan and deals with corruption in the Government of the Republic of China.
movies.simplePlot: Island of Greed is a 1997 Hong Kong action crime thriller film directed by Michael Mak and starring Andy Lau and Tony Leung Ka-fai. The film is set and filmed in Taiwan and deals with corruption in the Government of the Republic of China.

biography.bio: Andy Lau Tak-wah, (born 27 September 1961) is a Hong Kong actor, singer-songwriter, presenter, and film producer. Lau has been one of Hong Kong's most commercially successful film actors since the mid-1980s, performing in more than 160 films while maintaining a successful singing career at the same time. In the 1990s, Lau was branded by the media as one of the Four Heavenly Kings of Cantopop. Lau was entered into the Guinness World Records for the "Most Awards Won by a Cantopop Male Artist". By April 2000, he had already won a total unprecedented 292 awards. In 2005, Lau was awarded "No.1 Box office Actor 1985-2005" of Hong Kong, yielding a total box office of HKD 1,733,275,816 for shooting 108 films in the past 20 years. In 2007, Lau was also awarded the "Nielsen Box Office Star of Asia" by the Nielsen Company.
biography.name: Andy Lau

actors.character: Capt. Fong Kuo-Fai, Bureau of Investigation Artillery Team

biography.bio: Tony Leung Ka-fai is a four-time Hong Kong Film Award-winning film actor. As he is often confused with actor Tony Chiu-Wai Leung, Tony Leung Ka-fai is known as "Big Tony", while Tony Chiu-Wai Leung is known as "Little Tony", nicknames which correspond to the actors' respective physical statures. Leung has been in the film industry for more than 30 years, starring in a variety of roles. His debut film was Burning of the Imperial Palace (1983), where he played the Xianfeng Emperor. He would later work with Yun-Fat Chow in three films, Prison on Fire (1987), A Better Tomorrow III: Love and Death in Saigon (1989), and The Return of the God of Gamblers (1994). In 1991, Leung went to France to appear in Jean-Jacques Annaud's The Lover (1992), based on Marguerite Duras's novel, as the older lover of a young teen schoolgirl, who was played by British actress Jane March. Leung's ongoing career has seen him star in films such as The Myth (2005), Double Vision (2002), Everlasting Regret (2005) and Election (2005).
biography.name: Tony Ka Fai Leung

biography.bio: Paulyn Sun is an Singapore-born actress and Miss Singapore of 1994 and represented her country at Miss Universe. She quit her job in business development to launch an acting career in Hong Kong. Her first acting role was in the movie "The Golden Girls (1995)." In 1996 she was offered 20 million (Hong Kong) dollars to pose nude and rejected the offer. She was the first female from Singapore to be nominated for a Hong Kong Film Award in 1997 for her role in "Island Of Greed." In 2000, she was featured in Wong Kar Wai's award-winning film "In The Mood For Love" but most of her scenes were not put into the final cut. She has worked in many commercials for ATVs and beauty products in an effort to further advance her career. She is lesser known than her acting peers in Hong Kong despite her efforts. She can fluently speak English, Chinese (dialects Cantonese and Mandarin), and Japanese and has used all three languages in her roles.
biography.name: Paulyn Sun

biography.bio: Annie Wu was born on August 21, 1978 in Taiwan as Chen-Chun Wu. She is known for her work on Police Story 4: First Strike (1996), Island of Greed (1997) and Ban sheng yuan (1997).
biography.name: Annie Wu

biography.bio: Kelly Kuo was born on July 5, 1971 in Taiwan as Chin-Chun Kuo. She is an actress, known for Island of Greed (1997), Betelnut Beauty (2001) and Tokyo Juliet (2006). She has been married to Sin-Guei Wang since April 30, 2006. They have two children.
biography.name: Kelly Kuo

biography.bio: Winston Chao was born on June 9, 1960 in Taiwan as Wen-hsuan Chao. He is an actor, known for The Wedding Banquet (1993), Eat Drink Man Woman (1994) and 1911 (2011).
biography.name: Winston Chao

biography.bio: Doze Niu was born on June 22, 1966 in Taipei, Taiwan as Chen-Zer Niu. He is an actor and director, known for Monga (2010), What on Earth Have I Done Wrong?! (2007) and Love (2012).
biography.name: Doze Niu

biography.bio: Li-Chun Lee was born on May 2, 1952 in Hsinchu, Taiwan. He is known for his work on Papa, Can You Hear Me Sing? (1983), Secret Love in Peach Blossom Land (1992) and Niang yao jia ren (2012).
biography.name: Li-Chun Lee

biography.bio: Shih-Chieh Chin was born on December 29, 1951 in Pingtung, Taiwan. He is known for his work on The Fourth Portrait (2010), The Final Master (2015) and Le règne des assassins (2010).
biography.name: Shih-Chieh Chin

biography.bio: Fuzhu Liu is an actor, known for Island of Greed (1997).
biography.name: Fuzhu Liu

biography.bio: Hai-Ming Wang is an actor, known for Island of Greed (1997).
biography.name: Hai-Ming Wang

biography.bio: Jui Wang was born on July 25, 1930 in China as Wang Hsi-jui. He was an actor, known for Eat Drink Man Woman (1994), My Old Boy (2014) and Island of Greed (1997). He died on June 1, 2016 in Taipei, Taiwan.
biography.name: Jui Wang

biography.bio: Adam Chung-Tai Chan is known for his work on Le règne des assassins (2010), Colour of the Loyalty (2005) and Naked Killer (1992).
biography.name: Adam Chung-Tai Chan

biography.bio: Kuang-Chien Chen is an actor, known for Island of Greed (1997), Born to Be King (2000) and Burning Island 2 (1997).
biography.name: Kuang-Chien Chen

biography.bio: Sung Young Chen was born in 1945 in Taiwan. He is an actor and director, known for La cité des douleurs (1989), The New Legend of Shaolin (1994) and Gorgeous (1999).
biography.name: Sung Young Chen

laboratory: Cine Art Laboratory Ltd., Hong Kong
